summary: This document is a chain of emails from June 27, 2019, between FBI agents, a Senior Financial Investigator, and AUSAs discussing the property deed history for 9 East 71st Street in New York. The emails focus on investigating the ownership transfer of the mansion from the Nine East 71st Street Corporation to Maple Inc., with Jeffrey Epstein signing as both grantor and grantee, and questioning the reported ownership history involving Leslie Wexner.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: President of Nine East 71st Street Corporation, Grantor/Grantee in property transfer
persons.context: Identified as the president of the corporation that owned the 9 East 71st Street property and as the signatory on the 2011 deed transferring the property to Maple Inc.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.role: Reported previous owner of 9 East 71st Street mansion
persons.context: Mentioned in public reports as having bought the mansion in 1989, remodeling it, and featuring it in Architectural Digest in 1995, with questions raised about whether he actually owned it or if Epstein did through a corporation.

connections.description: Potential financial/property ownership relationship, with Epstein possibly owning or controlling the 9 East 71st Street property through a corporation for which Wexner was the reported owner.

events.title: Purchase of 9 East 71st Street by Nine East 71st Street Corporation
events.description: The mansion at 9 East 71st Street, New York, was purchased by the Nine East 71st Street Corporation, with public reports indicating Leslie Wexner as the buyer.

events.title: Architectural Digest feature of Wexner's house
events.description: The 9 East 71st Street mansion was featured in Architectural Digest as Leslie Wexner's house.

events.title: Epstein claims ownership to New York Times
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein told the New York Times that the 9 East 71st Street house was his.

events.title: Property deed transfer to Maple Inc.
events.description: The last deed of record shows the property at 9 East 71st Street was transferred from Nine East 71st Street Corporation to Maple Inc., with Jeffrey Epstein signing as both grantor and grantee.

locations: St. Thomas, VI (location of Maple Inc.)
keyFacts: The property at 9 East 71st Street, New York, was owned by the Nine East 71st Street Corporation, which purchased it in 1989.
Jeffrey Epstein was the president of the Nine East 71st Street Corporation and signed the 2011 deed transferring the property to Maple Inc. as both grantor and grantee.
Public reports from 1989-1995 indicated Leslie Wexner owned and remodeled the mansion, but the investigation questions whether Epstein owned it through the corporation the entire time.
